description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is committing hundreds of millions of pounds over the next decade to Britain’s nuclear deterrent and energy infrastructure as part of a “critical national endeavour” to safeguard the industry and protect the country.
title: UK Pledges £350 Million For Nuclear Defense and Energy By 2030

description: French authorities have raised their security alert level to the maximum following the deadly Friday attack in a Moscow concert hall.
title: France Raises Security Alert to Max Level After Attack in Moscow

description: New Jersey first lady Tammy Snyder Murphy said she’s suspending her campaign for the US Senate seat held by Democrat Bob Menendez.
title: NJ First Lady Tammy Murphy Suspends Campaign for US Senate

description: Senegal’s electoral authority was wrapping up counting ballots in a presidential election that’s too close to call.
title: Senegal Counts Ballots in Tightly Contested Presidential Vote

description: Vice President Kamala Harris declined to rule out consequences for Israel if it invades the crowded southern Gaza city of Rafah, a step the US has repeatedly warned against.
title: Harris Won’t Rule Out US Consequences If Israel Invades Rafah

description: Ireland’s Simon Harris was named leader of his liberal Fine Gael party on Sunday, putting him on course to become prime minister following the unexpected announcement last week that Leo Varadkar would resign.
title: Ireland’s Harris Set to Become Prime Minister in Uncontested Bid

description: Russia struck an underground gas storage facility in western Ukraine during Sunday missile and drone attack, underlining threats to the country’s energy system posed by war.
title: Ukraine Says Russian Barrage Aimed at Underground Gas Storage

description: The Conservative Party will keep the protection on pension increases known as the triple lock in their manifesto for this year’s elections, despite constraints on public finances.
title: Conservatives Will Keep Pension ‘Triple Lock’ in Platform, Hunt Says

description: As Donald Trump sits in a Manhattan court room Monday for a hearing related to one of his criminal cases, he’ll also be facing a moment of truth for his finances: a deadline that same day to either post a bond to cover a $454 million civil fraud verdict or risk having New York state start the process of seizing some of his assets.
title: Trump Faces Moment of Truth for His Finances in Manhattan Court

description: Consumers expecting big savings from a National Association of Realtors’ class-action settlement over agent commissions may instead be in for a letdown.
title: US Homebuyers Expecting $10,000 Savings Face Tough Reality

description: Hello again. Here’s what we’re talking about heading into the new week.The big hearing: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak appears before Parliament’s Liaison Committee on Tuesday and is likely to be grilled about the economy, global issues and “strategic thinking in government.” As we know, much of the strategic thinking right now is about how to avoid a Tory wipeout at the next general election. The big speech: Hawkish Bank of England policymaker Catherine Mann speaks in Belfast on Monday and may have
title: Parliamentary Panel to Grill Sunak on Economy: UK Sunday Briefing

description: Italy’s finance minister sees the nation’s economy expanding by 1% this year, the fastest pace predicted for the euro region’s three largest economies.
title: Italy’s Finance Ministry Sees Economy Growing 1% This Year

description: South Africa will ramp up nationwide power outages from Sunday as the state-owned utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. looks to replenish emergency reserves.
title: South Africa’s Eskom Sets New Blackouts to Replenish Reserves

description: The deadly attack in a Moscow concert hall has plunged anxious Russians back to a time they thought they’d left behind, when a wave of violence engulfed the country early in President Vladimir Putin’s rule.
title: Russians Relive Dark Memories as Attack Shatters Moscow Bubble

description: Russia was holding a national day of mourning on Sunday following the terrorist attack that killed at least 137 people in Moscow, as officials continue to suggest a Ukrainian role in the massacre claimed by Islamic State.
title: Russia Mourns Victims After Deadly Moscow Terrorist Attack

description: Senegal’s voters began casting their ballots in a presidential election in which the leading candidates offer a choice between policy continuity or a radical new course for one of Africa’s fastest-growing economies.
title: Senegal Votes in Presidential Election That’s Too Close to Call

description: A Thai opposition politician facing mounting challenges to his political survival widened his lead over Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin in a new survey, underscoring divisions in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Thai Opposition Figure Widens Lead Over Prime Minister in Poll

description: A general view of a classroom at Kuriga school in Kuririga on March 8, 2024, where more than 250 pupils kidnapped by gunmen. Nigeria's President Bola Ahmed Tinubu on March 8, 2024 sent troops to rescue more than 250 pupils kidnapped by gunmen from a school in the country's northwest in one of the largest mass abductions in three years. The Kaduna state attack was the second mass kidnapping in a week in Africa's most populous state, where heavily armed criminal gangs on motorbikes target victims in villages and schools and along highways in the hunt for ransom payments. Local government officials in Kaduna State confirmed the kidnapping attack on Kuriga school on March 7, 2024, but they have still not given figures as they said they were still working out how many children had been abducted. (Photo by Haidar Umar / AFP) (Photo by HAIDAR UMAR/AFP via Getty Images)
title: Nearly 300 Abducted Nigerian Schoolchildren Freed After 2 Weeks

description: Yemen-based Houthis fired a missile at a Chinese-owned oil tanker called M/V Huang Pu on Saturday, the US Central Command said.
title: Houthis Fired Missile at Chinese-Owned Ship in Red Sea, US Says

description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang downplayed investor concerns of challenges facing the economy, saying Beijing is stepping up policy support to spur growth and systemic risks are being addressed.
title: Chinese Premier Downplays Economy Risks, Highlights Policy Space

description: Simon Harris is set to become the new leader of Fine Gael when nominations close later on Sunday.
title: Simon Harris Set to Become Ireland’s Youngest Prime Minister
